messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] MSNBC Survey on Homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/15/05 3:14:46 PM, lhedbor@gmail.com writes: -=-I would try to summon up the appropriate words of rage-=- No survey is worth being enraged
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/15/05 3:14:46 PM, lhedbor@... writes:


-=-I would try to summon up the appropriate words of rage-=-


No survey is worth being enraged about.
Few things are.

Let's keep avoiding politics on this list, please.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] MSNBC Survey on Homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Well, it s pretty easy to see from the results to the first question where most of the respondents to this Web site s surveys are coming from, politically.
messages.messageBody:
Well, it's pretty easy to see from the results to the first question where
most of the respondents to this Web site's surveys are coming from,
politically. This helps to explain the current results to the homeschooling
opinion poll - doubtless the NEA and their ilk have sent out an alert to
their membership to be sure that homeschooling comes off looking as bad as
possible.

I would try to summon up the appropriate words of rage, but to tell the
truth, I'm just dog tired right now...

- Lars D. H. Hedbor
Â  Author, Small Business Projects/INTERNET
www.smallbusinessprojects.com/INTERNET
